item.title: 前官员称日本央行利率可能高于共识
item.description: 日本央行的一位前执行董事表示，日本央行可能会继续上调基准利率，上调幅度将超过目前的市场共识，而且今年有可能在上个月上调基准利率的基础上再上调两次。【原文：The Bank of Japan is likely to keep raising its benchmark rate to a level exceeding the current market consensus, and there’s a chance two more moves could come this year on top of last month’s hike, according to a former executive director at the central bank.】

item.title: 谷歌从公开的人工智能原则中删除有关武器的措辞
item.description: Alphabet Inc.旗下的谷歌公司已从其公开上市的人工智能原则中删除了一段关于其不会追求的应用的关键内容，该原则指导着这家科技巨头在该行业的工作。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google has removed a key passage about applications it will not pursue from its publicly listed artificial intelligence principles, which guide the tech giant’s work in the industry.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易谈判在即，加拿大忧心忡忡，担心失去生意
item.description: 美国和加拿大在最后一刻达成了避免贸易战的协议，这给投资者带来了暂时的喘息机会，但加拿大领导人对未来高风险的谈判发出了警告。【原文：A last-minute deal to head off a trade war between the US and Canada has given investors a temporary reprieve, but Canadian leaders are warning about the high-stakes negotiations ahead.】

item.title: 戴利称美联储可慢慢应对特朗普政策
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）表示，美国经济状况良好，央行无需对特朗普政府出台的政策做出快速反应。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco Mary Daly said the US economy was in a good position, and the central bank didn’t need to react quickly to policies introduced by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 特朗普 5000 亿美元的星际之门投资是现实还是炒作？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在就职典礼的第二天宣布了一个在美国扩大人工智能基础设施的项目，称其为 "迄今为止 "历史上最大的同类建设。【原文：On the day after his inauguration, President Donald Trump announced a project to expand artificial intelligence infrastructure in the US, calling it the biggest buildout of its kind in history “by far.”】

item.title: 敦促国会保护联邦统计数据免遭特朗普 "清洗
item.description: 一个联邦统计倡导组织正敦促国会恢复被特朗普政府删除的任何政府数据，并防止这种情况再次发生。【原文：A federal statistics advocacy group is urging Congress to restore any government data removed by the Trump administration and prevent it from happening again.】

item.title: 关税取决于时机
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 特朗普的加密货币项目似乎在关税崩溃后购买了以太币
item.description: 世界自由金融公司（World Liberty Financial）是一个与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）家族有关联的去中心化金融项目，在美国总统对墨西哥和加拿大短暂征收关税导致加密货币市场在周末暴跌之后，该公司似乎增加了价值数千万美元的以太币加密货币。【原文：World Liberty Financial, the decentralized-finance project linked to Donald Trump’s family, appears to have added tens of million of dollars worth of the Ether cryptocurrency after crypto markets crashed during the weekend as the US president briefly imposed tariffs on Mexico and Canada.】

item.title: Roblox 的 "布鲁克海文 RP "视频游戏被神秘创作者出售
item.description: Brookhaven RP 是 Roblox 公司视频游戏服务中最受欢迎的游戏，它的神秘创造者将其出售给了 Voldex Entertainment 有限公司，这是一家专门开发用户生成游戏的初创公司。【原文：Brookhaven RP, the most popular title on Roblox Corp.’s video-game service, was sold by its mystery creator to Voldex Entertainment Ltd., a startup that specializes in developing user-generated titles.】

item.title: 加拿大科技领袖发起组织影响政治动荡
item.description: 在加拿大顶级科技企业家的支持下，一个团体发起了一项在今年大选前推广政策的努力。【原文：A group with the backing of top Canadian tech entrepreneurs has launched an effort to promote policies ahead of a general election this year.】

item.title: 泽连斯基敦促议会支持增建核反应堆
item.description: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）敦促立法者批准在乌克兰西部的一座核电站增建两台发电机。【原文：Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy urged lawmakers to approve the completion of two additional generators at a nuclear power plant in the west of Ukraine.】

item.title: 关税如何运作？谁支付、谁征收及其他
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普承诺对美国最大的贸易伙伴征收惩罚性关税，这令经济和市场感到震惊。迄今为止，他已对中国征收了 10%的关税，推迟了对墨西哥和加拿大征收 25% 关税的计划，并表示下一个目标是欧盟。然而，除了这些噪音，关税也有实际影响。以下是关税的运作方式，从谁实际支付关税到如何征收关税。【原文：US President Donald Trump has rattled economies and markets with his promise of imposing punitive tariffs on the nation’s largest trade partners. So far he’s implemented 10% levies on China; delayed plans to hit Mexico and Canada with a 25% duty tax; and indicated that he’s coming for the European Union next. Yet beyond all that noise, tariffs have on-the-ground implications. Here’s how they work — from who actually pays to how the revenue is collected.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利推动 X 债务出售，投资者支持马斯克押注
item.description: 据知情人士透露，以摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）为首的一批银行将大幅增加出售与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体平台 X 有关的贷款，因为投资者的需求强于预期。【原文：A group of Morgan Stanley-led banks is set to substantially increase a sale of loans tied to Elon Musk’s social-media platform X after receiving stronger-than-expected demand from investors, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 芯片制造商称特朗普的关税威胁给他们的前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 在芯片供过于求、需求疲软的半导体行业中，英飞凌科技公司（Infineon Technologies AG）在动荡中摸索前行，为未来带来了一些希望。至少目前是这样。【原文：In a semiconductor industry that’s been struggling with an oversupply of chips and weak demand, Infineon Technologies AG navigated its way through the turbulence and offered some hope for the future. At least for now.】

item.title: Meta 的卡普兰对欧盟人工智能法规发出反击信号
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司新任全球事务主管乔尔-卡普兰（Joel Kaplan）表示，这家社交媒体巨头将不会签署欧盟的《人工智能实践守则》，这将使 Meta 在继续大力投资人工智能技术的同时与欧洲监管机构产生矛盾。【原文：Joel Kaplan, Meta Platforms Inc.’s new head of global affairs, signaled that the social media giant will not sign on to the European Union’s AI Code of Practice, putting Meta at odds with European regulators as it continues to invest heavily in artificial intelligence technology.】

item.title: 大科技公司的巨额支出掩盖了资本支出增长的放缓
item.description: 随着美国公司公布第四季度业绩，S&P 500 指数中最大的七家公司与其他公司之间的鸿沟正在拉开。这些巨头正在快速增加支出，而其他公司则在勉力维持。【原文：As Corporate America reports fourth-quarter results, a chasm is opening between the seven biggest companies in the S&P 500 Index and everyone else. The giants are boosting their spending at a rapid pace, while the others are barely treading water.】

item.title: 64 个非政府组织要求欧盟因刚果战争取消与卢旺达的矿产协议
item.description: 主要来自刚果民主共和国的 64 个组织联名写信，要求欧盟取消与卢旺达的重要矿产合作关系，因为卢旺达支持刚果东部的一个反叛组织。【原文：A group of 64 organizations mainly from the Democratic Republic of Congo sent a letter asking the European Union to cancel a critical minerals partnership with Rwanda because of its support for a rebel group in eastern Congo.】

item.title: 铁矿石生产商 Ferrexpo 遭乌克兰 38 亿美元民事索赔后暴跌 51
item.description: 在伦敦上市的矿业公司 Ferrexpo PLC 的股价下挫高达 51%，因为该公司称其位于东欧国家的子公司遭到了价值 1,570 亿乌克兰格里夫尼亚（38 亿美元）的民事索赔。【原文：Shares in London-listed miner Ferrexpo PLC sank as much as 51% after the company said a civil claim worth 157 billion Ukrainian hryvnias ($3.8 billion) had been filed against its subsidiary in the Eastern European country.】

item.title: CFTC 要求 Robinhood 终止超级碗体育赛事合约
item.description: Robinhood Markets 公司表示，它收到了美国商品期货交易委员会（Commodity Futures Trading Commission）的正式请求，要求它暂停为交易者提供对 2 月 9 日超级碗橄榄球赛结果的投注服务。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. said it received a formal request from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to suspend its offerings for traders to place bets on the outcomes of the Feb. 9 Super Bowl football game.】

item.title: 美国最大的贸易往来暂时获得关税缓和
item.description: 得克萨斯州拉雷多的恐慌有所缓解，但时间已经再次滴答作响。【原文：The panic eased in Laredo, Texas, but the clock is already ticking again.】

item.title: 英国纸币印刷商考虑竞购整个公司，股价大涨
item.description: De La Rue Plc 的股价在伦敦交易中涨至近三年来的最高点，此前这家印钞公司称，在未具名买家与公司进行初步接洽后，公司正在考虑出售整个公司。【原文：Shares of De La Rue Plc rallied to a nearly three-year high in London trading after the banknote printer said it was considering selling the whole company following preliminary approaches from unnamed buyers.】

item.title: 特朗普关税可能导致美国房屋建造成本上升 2.9 万美元
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税计划有可能提高美国的房屋建造成本，使本已面临住房市场紧缩的美国人更加举步维艰。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariff plans threaten to raise US home construction costs, making it even more difficult for Americans already facing a tight housing market.】

item.title: 欧盟国家集团就放宽天然气储存目标举行会谈
item.description: 由于担心高昂的价格使储存天然气变得无利可图，拥有该地区最大储量的一些欧洲国家就 2025 年后放宽加气目标的问题举行了早期非正式会谈。【原文：A group of European countries that hold the biggest reserves in the region have held early stage and informal talks about softening refilling targets after 2025 amid concerns that high prices are making it unprofitable to store gas.】

item.title: 哈格蒂助手卢克-佩蒂特被任命为财政部银行政策主管
item.description: 特朗普政府已任命共和党参议员比尔-哈格蒂（Bill Hagerty）的幕僚卢克-佩蒂特（Luke Pettit）担任美国财政部高级职务。【原文：The Trump administration has tapped Luke Pettit, a staffer for Republican Senator Bill Hagerty, for a senior role in the US Treasury Department.】

item.title: 中国对美国石油征收关税正值出口从峰值下滑之际
item.description: 中国对美国石油实施的第一轮制裁受到了冷遇，交易商们猜测此举不太可能影响美国的原油出口。【原文：The first round of Chinese sanctions to hit US oil were received with a whimper, and traders are speculating that the move is unlikely to rattle American exports of crude.】

item.title: 皇家加勒比获得 S&P 高级信用评级
item.description: 几天前，皇家加勒比游轮有限公司（Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd.）在其最繁忙的订票期创下了创纪录的开端，S&P 全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）将其评级恢复为投资级。【原文：Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. has returned to investment-grade status at S&P Global Ratings, days after the cruise operator posted a record start to its busiest booking period.】

item.title: 苹果首次推出邀请函应用程序，AppleCare 在订阅服务方面的变化
item.description: 苹果公司推出了一款用于创建活动邀请函的新应用程序，并对其 AppleCare+ iPhone 客户支持进行了调整，这是苹果公司为获得更多订阅收入而采取的更广泛举措的一部分。【原文：Apple Inc. rolled out a new app for creating event invitations and made changes to its AppleCare+ customer support for iPhones, part of a broader push to generate more subscription revenue.】

item.title: Meta 在史上最长连胜中增值 2350 亿美元
item.description: 由于投资者对这家社交媒体巨头的人工智能战略欢呼雀跃，Meta Platforms 公司股价有望连续第 12 个交易日上涨，创下有史以来最长连涨纪录。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. shares are on track to post a gain for a 12th consecutive session, their longest winning streak ever, as investors cheer the social media giant’s artificial intelligence strategy.】

item.title: 欧洲利率上扬势头减弱，投资银行家扛起大旗
item.description: 投资银行家再次成为欧洲贷款机构盈利的明星，因为他们从金融市场的波动中获益，弥补了利息收入预期放缓的影响。【原文：Investment bankers once again emerged as the stars in European lenders’ earnings as they benefited from volatility in financial markets, making up for an expected slowdown in interest income.】

item.title: 医疗科技公司 Brainlab 据称将为德国 IPO 挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，德国医疗技术公司 Brainlab AG 已选定银行为其首次公开募股提供咨询，该公司的估值可能在 20 亿欧元（21 亿美元）到 30 亿欧元之间。【原文：German medical technology company Brainlab AG has picked banks to advise on an initial public offering, which could value the firm between €2 billion ($2.1 billion) and €3 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】
